Citrine is the second most abundant mineral in the Earth. It is November's birthstone.
Citrine is the second most abundant mineral in the Earth. It is November's birthstone.

Peridot is one of few gems that occurs in only one colour, which is green.
Azurite is a soft, deep-blue copper mineral produced by weathering of copper ore deposits.
Azurite is a soft, deep-blue copper mineral produced by weathering of copper ore deposits.
Amethyst is a variety of quartz. Its purple colour comes from impurities in the crystal structure.
Amethyst is a variety of quartz. Its purple colour comes from impurities in the crystal structure.
Basalt is Earth's most abundant bedrock. The Earth's ocean basins are underlain by basalt.
Basalt is Earth's most abundant bedrock. The Earth's ocean basins are underlain by basalt.

The $Trainer global variable contains information about the player, such as their trainer type, ID number, name, party Pokémon and money.
The $Trainer global variable contains information about the player, such as their trainer type, ID number, name, party Pokémon and money.
This information is in class Player.
This information is in class Player.
Map connections are how two maps are displayed next to each other in the overworld, allowing you to walk from one to the other.
Map connections are how two maps are displayed next to each other in the overworld, allowing you to walk from one to the other.
The connections are defined in the PBS file "connections.txt". There is a Debug feature that makes connecting maps easier.
The connections are defined in the PBS file "connections.txt". There is a Debug feature that makes connecting maps easier.
In the Debug menu, go to "Information options..." > "Edit Map Connections". Instructions are available within. You can move maps around with the mouse.
In the Debug menu, go to "Information options..." > "Edit Map Connections". Instructions are available within. You can move maps around with the mouse.
Every tile in a tileset has a terrain tag, which is a number. This number is used to give certain tiles special effects.
Every tile in a tileset has a terrain tag, which is a number. This number is used to give certain tiles special effects.
For example, ledge tiles have terrain tag 1, which means the player jumps over them. Ledge tiles also have a single passable direction (set separately).
For example, ledge tiles have terrain tag 1, which means the player jumps over them. Ledge tiles also have a single passable direction (set separately).
Grass tiles (in which you can have wild encounters) have terrain tag 2. Water tiles have terrain tag 6 or 7.
Grass tiles (in which you can have wild encounters) have terrain tag 2. Water tiles have terrain tag 6 or 7.
Terrain tag 0 means the tile has no special effect. See the wiki for more information and a complete list of all terrain tags and their effects.
Terrain tag 0 means the tile has no special effect.  See the wiki for more information and a complete list of all terrain tags and their effects.
You can only set terrain tags up to 7 via RPG Maker XP's Database. Essentials has terrain tags with higher numbers.
You can only set terrain tags up to 7 via RPG Maker XP's Database. Essentials has terrain tags with higher numbers.
To fully set a tileset's terrain tags, open the Debug menu and go to "Information options..." > "Edit Terrain Tags".
To fully set a tileset's terrain tags, open the Debug menu and go to "Information options..." > "Edit Terrain Tags".

Debug mode is a special way of playing the game. It unlocks various developer features to make it easier to access all parts of the game and test things.
Debug mode is a special way of playing the game. It unlocks various developer features to make it easier to access all parts of the game and test things.
Playing in Debug mode allows you to access the Debug menu (press F9 or find it in the pause menu).
Playing in Debug mode allows you to access the Debug menu (press F9 or find it in the pause menu).
The party screen and Pokémon storage have a similar debug menu for modifying a Pokémon's properties, such as its level or species.
The party screen and Pokémon storage have a similar debug menu for modifying a Pokémon's properties, such as its level or species.
You can use field moves at any time, and hold Ctrl to skip any battles and decide the outcome of Trainer battles. Hold Ctrl while moving to walk over anything.
You can use field moves at any time, and hold Ctrl to skip any battles and decide the outcome of Trainer battles. Hold Ctrl while moving to walk over anything.
A full list of Debug mode features is available on the wiki.
A full list of Debug mode features is available on the wiki.
The $DEBUG variable was set to true. This flag is set automatically during playtesting within RMXP. This is what causes the game to be in Debug mode.
The $DEBUG variable was set to true. This flag is set automatically during playtesting within RMXP. This is what causes the game to be in Debug mode.
Obtained all Gym Badges for the first and second regions.
Obtained all Gym Badges for the first and second regions.
To add a Gym Badge, use $Trainer.badges[X]=true where X is a number from 0 through 7. Use $Trainer.badges[X] to see if you have a Badge.
To add a Gym Badge, use $Trainer.badges[X]=true where X is a number from 0 through 7. Use $Trainer.badges[X] to see if you have a Badge.
Note that the first Gym Badge is number 0, the second Badge is number 1, and so on.
Note that the first Gym Badge is number 0, the second Badge is number 1, and so on.
In Debug mode, you can set which Gym Badges you have via the Debug menu.
In Debug mode, you can set which Gym Badges you have via the Debug menu.

Pyono is a card game where the goal is to be the first to discard all your game.
Each player starts with 7 cards and can either spend their turn discarding a card or drawing a new card.
Each player starts with 7 cards and can either spend their turn discarding a card or drawing a new card.
There are 5 types of cards: Grass, Fire, Water and Normal.
There are 5 types of cards: Grass, Fire, Water and Normal.
A card may be discarded if it matches the type of the previously-discarded card.
A card may be discarded if it matches the type of the previously-discarded card.
Normal-type cards can match with any type and upon being discarded will transform into the type of the player's choosing.
Normal-type cards can match with any type and upon being discarded will transform into the type of the player's choosing.
In addition to having types, cards also have abilities.
In addition to having types, cards also have abilities.

Number Cards have numbers on them. You may discard a card on them if the numbers match.
Whirl Cards will reverse the turn order. Other Whirl Cards may be discarded on them.
Whirl Cards will reverse the turn order. Other Whirl Cards may be discarded on them.
Skip Cards will skip the next player's turn. Other Skip Cards may be discarded on them.
Skip Cards will skip the next player's turn. Other Skip Cards may be discarded on them.
Draw Cards initiate a Draw Battle, where players must keep discarding Draw Cards and build up the total penalty.
Draw Cards initiate a Draw Battle, where players must keep discarding Draw Cards and build up the total penalty.
If a player choses to draw on their turn, the Draw Battle ends and that player will draw cards equal to the build up penalty.
If a player choses to draw on their turn, the Draw Battle ends and that player will draw cards equal to the build up penalty.
When a Draw Battle has ended, the next player may discard any card that matches the last type or new Draw Cards.
When a Draw Battle has ended, the next player may discard any card that matches the last type or new Draw Cards.

Triple Triad is a game played with special cards placed on a 3x3 board.
Each card has 4 numbers on it, one per side. These numbers are so-called stats.
Each card has 4 numbers on it, one per side.  These numbers are so-called stats.
Players take turns placing cards on the board. As they do so, they try to capture and gain control of their opponent's cards.
Players take turns placing cards on the board. As they do so, they try to capture and gain control of their opponent's cards.

Malignant Chain
Malignant Chain
[6]
1
Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams into the target with no letup.
Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams into the target with no letup.
2
The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.
The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.
3
The user vibrates its wings to generate a damaging sound wave. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
The user vibrates its wings to generate a damaging sound wave. It may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.
4
Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.
Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.
5
Fires an exploding pollen puff at enemies, or a HP-restoring one at allies.
Fires an exploding pollen puff at enemies, or a HP-restoring one at allies.
6
The user drains the target's blood. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
The user drains the target's blood. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.
7
The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This lowers the target's Attack stat.
The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This lowers the target's Attack stat.
8
The user slashes at the foe by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
The user slashes at the foe by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
9
The user attacks with a sinister beam of light. It may also confuse the target.
The user attacks with a sinister beam of light. It may also confuse the target.
10
After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
11
The user crushes its foes by rolling over them. This attack may make the target flinch.
The user crushes its foes by rolling over them. This attack may make the target flinch.
12
The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
13
The foe is attacked with powdery scales blown by wind. It may also raise all the user's stats.
The foe is attacked with powdery scales blown by wind. It may also raise all the user's stats.
14
When the user knocks out a target with this move, the user's Attack stat rises drastically.
When the user knocks out a target with this move, the user's Attack stat rises drastically.
15
While resisting, the user attacks the opposing Pokémon. The targets' Sp. Atk stat is reduced.
While resisting, the user attacks the opposing Pokémon. The targets' Sp. Atk stat is reduced.
16
The target is slashed with scythes or claws. Its power increases if it hits in succession.
The target is slashed with scythes or claws. Its power increases if it hits in succession.
17
Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
18
The foe is stabbed twice by a pair of stingers. It may also poison the target.
The foe is stabbed twice by a pair of stingers. It may also poison the target.
19
The target is infested and unable to flee for four to five turns.
The target is infested and unable to flee for four to five turns.
20
The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.
21
The user calls out its underlings to heal it. The user regains up to half of its max HP.
The user calls out its underlings to heal it. The user regains up to half of its max HP.
22
The target is covered in a powder that explodes and damages it if it uses a Fire-type move.
The target is covered in a powder that explodes and damages it if it uses a Fire-type move.
23
The user performs a beautiful dance. It boosts the user's Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
The user performs a beautiful dance. It boosts the user's Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
24
The user scatters irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opponents aim only at the user.
The user scatters irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opponents aim only at the user.
25
The user ensnares the target with thin, gooey silk so it can't flee from battle.
The user ensnares the target with thin, gooey silk so it can't flee from battle.
26
Weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stats upon switching in.
Weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stats upon switching in.
27
The foe is bound with silk blown from the user's mouth. This silk reduces the target's Speed.
The foe is bound with silk blown from the user's mouth. This silk reduces the target's Speed.
28
The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.
The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.
29
The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
30
Unleashes a barrage of multi-arm attacks, skipping protections. The user's Defense stat falls.
Unleashes a barrage of multi-arm attacks, skipping protections. The user's Defense stat falls.
31
The user turns the foe's power against it. It does more damage the higher the target's Attack stat.
The user turns the foe's power against it. It does more damage the higher the target's Attack stat.
32
The user swings both arms and hits the target. Ignores the target's stat changes.
The user swings both arms and hits the target. Ignores the target's stat changes.
33
The user lets loose a pitch-black shock wave at its target. It may also lower the target's accuracy.
The user lets loose a pitch-black shock wave at its target. It may also lower the target's accuracy.
34
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. It may also lower the target's Defense stat.
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. It may also lower the target's Defense stat.
35
The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. It may also make the target flinch.
The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. It may also make the target flinch.
36
The user attacks the target's throat. The target cannot use sound-based moves for two turns.
The user attacks the target's throat. The target cannot use sound-based moves for two turns.
37
The user slashes the target the instant an opportunity arises. Critical hits land more easily.
The user slashes the target the instant an opportunity arises. Critical hits land more easily.
38
This move enables the user to attack first. It fails if the target is not readying an attack, however.
This move enables the user to attack first. It fails if the target is not readying an attack, however.
39
The user slaps down the target's held item, preventing that item from being used in the battle.
The user slaps down the target's held item, preventing that item from being used in the battle.
40
If the target has already taken some damage in the same turn, this attack's power is doubled.
If the target has already taken some damage in the same turn, this attack's power is doubled.
41
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. It may make the target flinch.
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. It may make the target flinch.
42
The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.
The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.
43
The user draws up to the foe disarmingly, then throws a sucker punch. It hits without fail.
The user draws up to the foe disarmingly, then throws a sucker punch. It hits without fail.
44
The user attacks and steals the foe's held item simultaneously. It can't steal if the user holds an item.
The user attacks and steals the foe's held item simultaneously. It can't steal if the user holds an item.
45
The user yells as if it is ranting about something, making the target's Sp. Atk stat decrease.
The user yells as if it is ranting about something, making the target's Sp. Atk stat decrease.
46
If the user moves after the target, this attack's power will be doubled.
If the user moves after the target, this attack's power will be doubled.
47
An attack move that inflicts double damage if used on a target that is switching out of battle.
An attack move that inflicts double damage if used on a target that is switching out of battle.
48
The user gets all the party Pokémon to attack the foe. The more party Pokémon, the more damage.
The user gets all the party Pokémon to attack the foe. The more party Pokémon, the more damage.
49
The user flings its held item at the target to attack. Its power and effects depend on the item.
The user flings its held item at the target to attack. Its power and effects depend on the item.
50
The user boasts of its strength. Power increases the more the user's stats are raised.
The user boasts of its strength. Power increases the more the user's stats are raised.
51
This attack's power increases the more the target has powered up with stat changes.
This attack's power increases the more the target has powered up with stat changes.
52
Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.
Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.

My \TP's looking really awesome.\mI wish I could show you.\mHey, listen! I almost caught a \TE the other day.\mOh, it was sooooooo close, too!
My \TP's looking really awesome.\mI wish I could show you.\mHey, listen!  I almost caught a \TE the other day.\mOh, it was sooooooo close, too!
Want to battle? It's not going to be a repeat of the last time we met.\mI'll be waiting for you around \TM.
Want to battle?  It's not going to be a repeat of the last time we met.\mI'll be waiting for you around \TM.
Do you want to battle? I'm going to win this time!\mI'll be waiting for you around \TM.\mLook for me, OK? My \TP will be expecting you.
Do you want to battle?  I'm going to win this time!\mI'll be waiting for you around \TM.\mLook for me, OK?  My \TP will be expecting you.
Good morning, \PN.\mThis is \TN. Did I wake you?
